article.headline: Oklahoma State 82, Colorado State 49
article.story: TULSA, Okla. (AP) -- Oklahoma State's defense keeps bailing out its sloppy offense. John Lucas scored 17 points and the No. 24 Cowboys forced 31 turnovers in their 82-49 victory Wednesday night over Colorado State. Oklahoma State scored 27 of the game's final 33 points and didn't allow a basket in the last 12:21. The Cowboys (2-0) had 10 steals, blocked eight shots and drew six charges. "The story was our defense," coach Eddie Sutton said. "We made it awfully difficult for them to run their offense." Joey Graham added 12 points for Oklahoma State, which improved to 15-1 in games played at Oral Roberts' Mabee Center under Sutton. Matt Nelson led Colorado State (1-1) with 14 points. The Rams, an NCAA tournament team a year ago, shot just 31.8 percent. The Rams pulled to 55-43 with 10:36 remaining on single free throws by Nelson and Freddy Robinson. They capped an 8-2 run Colorado State used to cut into a 53-35 lead. But Oklahoma State went on a 24-1 sprint helped by six straight Rams turnovers. Ivan McFarlin had five points -- all from the line -- and Lucas and Graham four points each in the run. "We just did not have good chemistry, and this is what happens," Rams coach Dale Layer said. "Turnovers are killers. You have guys trying to do too many things." The Cowboys forced 27 turnovers in their 90-62 victory last Friday night over Northwestern State when the defense helped an offense that had 22 of its own miscues and made just 15 of 27 free throws. Oklahoma State improved a bit Wednesday, turning it over just 16 times and making 18 of 26 from the line. But the Cowboys allowed Colorado State 11 offensive rebounds and 29 free throw attempts. "I think the biggest problem we have right now other than too much fouling and not rebounding well on defense is we're not as smooth in our halfcourt offense as we need to be," Sutton said. Oklahoma State relied on 23 fast-break points. Stingy defense and two runs helped the Cowboys take a 41-25 halftime lead. Oklahoma State forced 19 first-half turnovers while drawing five charges and blocking three Rams shots. The Cowboys turned two Rams turnovers into Graham's dunk and Tony Allen's reverse layup in an 8-0 run that made it 22-10 with 10:43 remaining in the half. Daniel Bobik's 3-pointer from the left wing started the Cowboys' 16-4 run that expanded the lead to 40-21 with 2:24 left in the half. Oklahoma State hit seven of eight free throws and six Cowboys scored in the spurt.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
